sentences.english: His officials administered the domains and collected the rent from the colons .
sentences.chinese: 他的手下管理领地并向佃户收租。

sentences.english: He summoned his tenants to appear before him.
sentences.chinese: 他召集佃户们来到他跟前。

sentences.english: The new rulers took farms from the landlords and gave them to the tenants.
sentences.chinese: 新的政府从地主手中取得了田土，并把它们分给佃户。

sentences.english: Russia made the peasant the tenant of the state.
sentences.chinese: 俄国把农民变成了国家的佃户。

sentences.english: Homage wasaccordinglythe acknowledgment ofthebond tenure between lord and tenant.
sentences.chinese: 效忠同样也是对领主和佃户之间租赁契约的确认。

sentences.english: Now they tell me that first of the tenants are to flit tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 刚才他们告诉我，第一批的佃户们明天就得搬走。

sentences.english: But the company can be a harsh overlord to its crofters.
sentences.chinese: 但是公司对其佃户和工人可以作威作福，苛刻异常。

definition: a scholar or government official living in one's village/a village gentleman/squire
to rent out one's land (to tenant farmers)
(old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
